name: lucas
text: To this day, I occasionally get the image of Roast Beef with that makeup on and I laugh.  Then I puke.

name: jesler729
text: It's truly one of the funniest images. Personally, I think this one would be better if it ended with the second to last panel, but it's still great.

name: heccibiggs
text: But - but he comepletely wants to use art! How can you not love that? Completely!

name: heccibiggs
text: Motherfucking typo.

name: klaus
text: I love Ray's pure joy in the first panel. This whole story arc animates so well in my head. I think it's probably my favorite.

name: deusoma
text: He's still buzzed enough to not be upset as he explains the power of the Volvo to Mr. Bear in the second panel.

name: bigtom
text: your avatar scares me

name: deusoma
text: If I change it to something else, it might get angry. And I sure as hell don't want that to happen again.

name: biddlebubbly
text: Bad taste and ill-advised male makeup: a weapon turned on the self; castrating and ostracizing.

name: dallovich
text: Aint that Ray's tape though? The E's are his siganture, so Ray perhaps listens to the cure when noone else is around?!

name: knuckleheadbabylon
text: I never thought I would ever see Beef in guyliner. The car has powerful juju.

name: sp1derbaby
text: He's presumably listening to The Cure as well.

name: sargasm
text: Frankly, the tape is the most frightening of all three objects in the glove box.

name: fuzzery
text: Only liberals listen to the cure.

name: xerol
text: The surprising part is the label's in Ray's handwriting (look at the Es).

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Ray has hell of secrets

name: ham_shoes
text: Maybe he used it when he was trying to make amends with Teodor

name: closefriend
text: A comment left by closefriend was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Ebessan, Art-Vader, Dainbramage, Mastronaut, LRosetw8, morganization)

name: zedpower
text:
He applied it to his hair, and pulled his polish-covered hair over his eyes.

At least I hope so.

name: mat4900
text: I think the shoe polish name is a reference to the old shoe-shine shops you use to get from the nineteenth to the early twentieth century.

name: connellingus
text: "Yes, Sir!" is just the way someone who shines your shoes would probably address you. If it were "Yes, Suh!" it would arguably be racist, but not as it stands.

name: chrissketch
text: Ah. The name of the shoe polish is not phonetically racist.

name: sexualhomeboy
text: Look at his avatar.  He is obviously an authority on the subject.

name: tekende
text: There's also eyeliner in there, and panel 9 shows him applying it, not the shoe polish, to his eyes.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i thought of the military when i saw the 'yes sir' on the polish can.  but then i remembered that the nowadays, as for military garb, desert boots dont need to be polished, and class a shoes are shiny on thier own.

name: scrumpton
text: This strip is brilliant for (among other things) the use of "unmitigated nincompoopery"

name: lizjones
text: Ray looks downright pregnant in his strip.

name: mat4900
text: Cornelius totally calls ray out in this strip for his carelessness towards Roast Beef and the Volvo of Despair

name: nutmeg
text: A comment left by nutmeg was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, atom, AaronGStock)

name: firesign
text: Man... you can't just go adding something that came into existence AFTER both other things into the middle section of a Transitive Property statement... Well, I guess there's not a rule against it, but all the same, it just doesn't feel right. I mean, the strip already sets up the equation for us without the need for transitivity. The math teacher has spoken.

name: sp1derbaby
text: The term "equality" doesn't apply in general when discussing relational properties. The internet pedant has spoken :-)

name: trevor
text: Roast Beef wants what we all want.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Candy?

name: darkwaffle
text: I totally busted out laughing at this strip.

name: elvaquero
text: the last panel is one of my favorite achewood moments

name: riazm
text: Beef's depression just levelled up.

name: yaegmenthor
text:
New Prestiege Class: Avatar of Despair
Requirements: Crippling Depression 15 Ranks, Cicumstances Feat, and Trent Reznor's Volvo of Despair (Artifact)

name: nigelchaos
text: What base class would it be? ... Bard?

name: soticoto
text:
Bard or Ex-Paladin.

The class actually has -1D4 health degradation per level.

name: mattylite
text: If rowboat were here, he'd say "y'all some nerds."  But since he's not, I'll say it.  Y'all some nerds.

name: someone3
text: there are no weapons more dangerous then these to a severely depressed person

name: keithcozz
text: All Beef needs now is a swishy cape and a ticket to Paris.

name: yaegmenthor
text: A comment left by yaegmenthor was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, kenthegod, cailetshadow)

name: yaegmenthor
text:
Oh wait "busking" not "basking".
Man, I failed something fierce

name: deusoma
text: There is no possible way you could fail if that was you who took the time to try to bring Beef's random thought to life.

name: yaegmenthor
text: Maybe I can add a banjo or drumset or something really fast, withouth messing with the picture. I like how it turned out, also I am lazy and do not want to start all over.

name: yaegmenthor
text: [url=http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v210/dndboy13/etchings/art-1b.png>Or maybe a Ukulele (oh god did I spell that right) and a bitchin top hat[/url]

name: yaegmenthor
text:
Try it again
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v210/dndboy13/etchings/art-1b.png

name: professoryes
text: C'est magnifique. But really.

name: heyman
text: yes it is art.  nicely done

name: dougthehead
text: What we need more of... is art.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Wow, you completely used art to convey the image of a skeleton busking in a subway system in post-apocalyptic Paris! And it looks awesome as well.

Chubbchubbchubb.

name: norrec
text: Hello new desktop!

name: i_love_kate
text: Someone has lamed everyone who has vocalised their approval of this art. That's pretty dick.

name: tekende
text: It was Christo.

name: carlyle
text: it was me

name: spinynorman
text: Ray's dumbfounded expression is the simplest drawing of him and for some reason one of the funniest. It's like Cornelius's explanation blew up all thought in his head.

name: relaxing
text: A comment left by relaxing was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by kenthegod, rowboat, cailetshadow)

name: epicurus
text: The last panel is the biography of a lot people these days.

name: steerpike66
text: I'm sure that the last image has already been rendered perfectly by someone like Poppy Z Brite.

name: beansdooma
text: panel six is a winner

name: direhaggis
text: This is not the first time Roast Beef has been suddenly captivated by a skeleton musician .

name: direhaggis
text: Well damn it. http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua1Kz92N.

name: charchar
text: oh, dang. The Top . Onstad brought some serious pain for Robert Smith and those who love him. dang.

name: charchar
text: I post this because it is vaguely relevant and I can

name: st_elmos_fire
text: nah, The Top is an album that can be easily ridiculed, only a couple actual good songs on it, it's mainly Robert just tripping balls in the recording studio with a drummer. S'kinda fun to listen to but not particularly good at all.

name: charchar
text: I always wondered about those hooting sounds he kept making on that album(in Birdmad Girl, The Caterpillar, Bananafishbones, and Throw Your Foot even though it's a b-side ). Do 'shrooms do that to everybody, is that something weird with Robert, or what?

name: st_elmos_fire
text:
As far as I know, anything that comes out of the mouth of someone on shrooms is mainly babbling.
I do believe the songs Give Me It, and Bananafishbones are entirely products of weird trips.

However the hooting, is his thing of being poppy/psychedelic, I think it's probably like a trippy extension of Doo-wop. A bit of an expansion on the nonsense syllables in some Japanese Whispers songs, and, of course, of the Bowie inspired vocal grunts and things.

name: tekende
text: He was hooting because he wanted to be an owl.

name: st-elmos_fire
text:
This is also quite possible, oh the things shrooms will do to mostly good people
I also noticed that someone glanced at the above conversation and lamed its entirety and then I laughed.

name: tbtabby
text: He would've been better off if there was a loaded gun in there.

name: echidnaboy
text: In this strip, Chris Onstad uses art to convey a tin of Old No. 12 "Yes, Sir!" Quality Shoe Polish in the glove compartment of Trent Reznor's car.

name: nerd_specs
text: This is hell of funny to me; MY bootlegged Cure tape looked exactly the same, with the three horizontal slashes for the E and the ahnk and everything. I lost it on the bus a long time ago... I wonder if Onstad found it?

name: st-elmos_fire
text:
seriously? an Ankh on the Cure, man . . .
I always wonder who popularised that as a "Goth" symbol, I imagine it must have been either Anne Rice (in probly Queen of the Damned, though I have not read it) or Neil Gaiman (Death, the Sandman comics). Both good writers but that is following them too far.

name: heccibiggs
text: Hey, guys! You'll notice that a lot of comments here have just one, seemingly very unnecessary lame. That is because some prick called "kenthegod" went and lamed everything, I assume giggling like a gnome and masturbating furiously as he did so. He has made almost no comments and received no chubbies or lames, but has gone around invisibly laming like his shitty little life depends on it. So I went to his profile, and found the one comment he has made, and lamed it out of principle. You may well think I am petty for doing this. Or you may wish to follow my example .

name: i_love_kate
text: Chubby for being a better detective than me, and also "masturbating furiously."

name: i_love_kate
text: To clarify, I approve of your humourous use of the phrase "masturbating furiously." Not the other, weirder thing.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I just thought it was your sign off, like for a letter or email:

Quote:
Masturbating furiously,

i_love_kate

name: tonyhighwind
text: You have done a good deed, miss, and I have fulfilled my obligation to your fine work.  The world needs more people like you.

name: venividieffluxi
text: I pray to God I never cross you...

name: greenkoolayd
text: grow some balls
